parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kratos; to use strength, i.e. Seize or retain.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A dragon or huge serpent; met: Satan. Probably from an alternate form of derkomai; a fabulous kind of serpent.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Original, primitive, ancient. From arche; original or primeval.
Probably from optanomai; a snake, figuratively, an artful malicious person, especially Satan.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
From diaballo; a traducer; specially, Satan.
An adversary, Satan. Of Chaldee origin corresponding to ma'bad; the accuser, i.e. The devil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A thousand. Plural of uncertain affinity; a thousand.
A year. Apparently a primary word; a year.
